description: From Latin sorbilis, from sorbere (“to suck in, to drink down”).

adjectives.description: sorbile (comparative more sorbile, superlative most sorbile)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Fit to be drunk or sipped.
examples: […]  he rejects, also, Lavoisier's hypothesis, who supposes that metallic substances calcined, contain dephlogisticated air; whereas, according to Mr. Lubbock, they contain only the basis of dephlogisticated air, that is the sorbile principle.
